inn1.comm: shuffles across onto off stump to study a back of a length ball outside off. Lets it go
almost pops back to the bowler. Guptill is looking to clip this shortish delivery off his hips, but is into the shot too early. Seems like it had stuck in the pitch for a bit longer than expected.

appeal for lbw, the umpire is unmoved, so Bangladesh have decided to challenge his call. It is a good length ball that brought Guptill forward to defend. But seems to have hit the front pad before it strikes bat. Is it in line with the stumps though? No. Ball-tracking says the impact was outside off. So third umpire Shamshuddin upholds on-field umpire Reiffel's decision

oh this is plumb! Lovely length from Mashrafe. This is a lot fuller, and it's attacking middle and leg stump. Guptill, still new at the crease, is falling over as he tries to hit across the line. The flick shot doesn't connect. Thereafter, it's a straightforward decision
back of a length and outside off, hint of away seam, Williamson watches it carry on to the wicketkeeper

gorgeous end to the over. The outswinger is floated up - disguised as a ball that can be cover driven - Williamson does not indulge. He knows the ball will move about in overcast conditions and chooses caution as the better part of valour

ripper, he'll definitely remember his first ball in ODIs. Runs in hard, hits this Saxton Oval deck, and gets it to seam away sharply past the shoulder of the bat. Tom Latham - a man who struck a century a few days ago - is squared up and then beaten.
fuller delivery outside off, laced with outswing, starts too wide and so Latham avoids it
gets more sighters as Roy continues to slant the ball across the left-hander
goes short and wide and he cracks it through cover point. Latham's superb in that region. His game is tailored on playing late and his square of the wicket play is very very good
length ball wandering outside off, Latham ushers it to the wicketkeeper
another length ball pitching on off stump and sliding on with the angle well outside the reach Latham, who leaves
127 kph, excellent leave from Williamson as he leaves a good length ball, looking for his outside edge. Mashrafe probes away on a fourth stump line, getting hints of movement away off the pitch
drifts into the pads this time, Williamson aims to glance it fine, but the swing in the air takes it out of his reach
strides forward to a fuller delivery on off stump and blocks with soft hands to point
gets up on his toes to blunt a shortish delivery outside off.
allows the back of a length delivery to come to him at off stump and then defuses it to point off the straight bat
a touch too straight and a touch too short, Williamson is nimble with his back and across movement to flick behind square leg
full and just outside off, defends off the front foot, with his head right over the ball
leaves on bounce. This is intended to be an awayseamer. But it pitches on off stump and holds its line instead. Latham trusts the pitch but he still must have had his heart in his mouth
fuller delivery on sixth stump, telling Latham to go for the on-the-up drive. Latham politely says no thank you and leaves
length on leg stump - poor ball - picked away to long leg
the leg trap almost works. Digs in a short ball on the body, climbs on Williamson a little more than he expects, gets a glove and the ball lands just short of leg gully

moves back and across to nudge a short ball off his hips. Normally that would be a fine shot, except Bangladesh are bowling to that plan. Bowling specifically for that shot. The plan almost works. Tanbir Hayder was the man lurking at leg gully, but he stands motionless as the ball flies low past his right
length ball on off stump, defended
back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms
steps forward to a good length ball on off stump and blunts it
firm punch off the back foot as Mashrafe angles a back of a length ball across the left-hander

beautiful. It's the length that is troubling Latham. Full, meaning it can swing, and swing it does. Sharply away from the bat and Latham, who was prodding at it, without any feet, is comfortably beaten
on the hips, and now Latham is able to flick it behind square leg. Easy release ball. Bangladesh shouldn't allow these

they've been good for the most part - but these deliveries - are ruining everything for Bangladesh. The captain offers up a buffet ball - short and wide - and Latham tucks in with a rasping cut in front of point

far too wide and Williamson helps it over the man at point. It wasn't entirely well controlled, but he knows there is no one riding the boundary square on the off side so he went through with the shot
angles the shortish ball into the body, WIlliamson indulges in a leg glance again, despite the leg gully that is in, doesn't make connection
pushes the ball off the back foot into the covers
lands it full on off stump and makes Williamson play. He keeps to the crease and blocks with a soft, straight bat
covers the line of a good length ball, seaming back in at him, and blocks to mid-on
pats the short of a length delivery on middle to the left of mid-on to retain strike
back of a length on off stump, defends
opens the face and glides a short of a length delivery on off stump behind point
half an appeal for leg before, but considering the ball pitches outside leg and strikes Latham on the thigh, it was very optimistic.
shortish and outside off, Williamson doesn't want anything to do with it
on the pads - aiming to bowl to the man at leg slip - Williamson makes sure to flick it a lot squarer. Need a lot more pace to pull this off. Mashrafe doesn't have that pace anymore
back of a length and outside off, Latham offers no shot
drives sweetly in front of point. Does take the risk of hitting on the up, but his timing is phenomenal. Right off the middle of the bat, as HotSpot confirms

wicketkeeper dives to his left, leg slip to his right, and the ball splits them! Roy has the extra pace to work towards this tactic. This ball is a touch fuller. Williamson goes for the flick, does not make connection with the bat though, clips the thigh and runs away
back of a length and outside off, allows it to carry on
fuller ball on off stump, defends

dropped. He could have had one of the best batsmen in the world as his first international wicket. Throws his hands up in the air in disappointment. The pitch helps him out to make this back of a length ball a lot more threatening than it should have been. Comes off a lot slower than the batsman expects, and Williamson, who was preparing to flick it wide of mid-on, gets a leading edge. Subashis watches it lob up, jumps to his right, sticks a hand out, but doesn't cling on
back of a length on off stump, Williamson nudges it to the right of mid-on and sets off for a quick single.
eased into the covers
good start. He pitches the ball up, outside off, Williamson leaves it
fuller delivery on off stump, defends to cover
lenght ball on off stump, blocks it with soft hands
presents the full face to a full ball on off stump

big appeal for a caught behind. But the umpire shakes his head and signals wide. It was short, it seems to bounce a little more than the batsman realises. Williamson goes for the cut and is beaten. Nicked this shot in the last ODI
full on off stump, blunts it
lets a shortish delivery come onto him on off stump and blocks
pushes him back on off stump, Latham defends
length ball pitches on leg stump, defends
blocks a good length ball on middle and leg stump
he's careful to present the full face with Roy pitching his fuller deliveries on leg stump and getting them to seam away
pushes off the back foot to mid-off
full on off stump, Latham wants to exploit the gap that has just been opened up on the leg side, but hits it to midwicket instead of the vacant space at square leg
fine shot as he pushes back in his crease to punch a short delivery to cover point
seems to get into the drive a touch too early and the length ball outside off holds on the pitch and wanders to midwicket off the inside edge
shuffles in line with the stumps and whips a length ball on leg to midwicket. Misses out. A few yards either side of that fielder could have been a boundary
pushes back to get on top of the bounce of this ball outside off and drives to cover

that's shot straight up and mid-on takes it. Tries to force the pace and a length ball on middle and leg stump takes the leading edge. Instead of going over midwicket - there is only one fielder there, if he had beat him, he would have had a boundary - it goes to Shakib who takes a dolly. The two-paced pitch, and rather more so the Bangladesh bowlers' discipline pays off
full on off stump, drives to mid-on
moves back to a length ball and clips it to midwicket

that's his signature. Pulls out the sweep, and he plays it superbly. First, he read the line right. It was down leg. The length is full, so very little risk of an lbw or top edge. All he has to do then is place it past fine leg and that's easy enough
rocks back to the flatter delivery and cracks it through point
flighed on off stump, Broom comes forward to block
moves back to a flatter delivery on off stump and drills it through the covers
moves back, makes room while doing so, which helps him play the back foot drive through point even if the ball does turn into him a little bit
back of a length and outside off, Latham let it pass
back of a length on off stump, taps it down
lets the shortish delivery outside off go
tap and run as Latham comes forward to a length ball on off stump and steers it in front of point
back of a length on off stump - Broom works it away to deep midwicket
glides a shortish delivery towards point

huge appeal for an lbw and it's been upheld. Latham has gone for a review though. He is in trouble this time, playing the sweep. Decides to play one to a ball pitching on off stump - and he misses. He's struck in line with middle. That's what happens when you choose to sweep a wicket-to-wicket ball and miss. Now it's all about ball-tracking. Pitching in line, impact in line, clipping enough of leg stump to be umpire's call. Chris Brown, on debut, sends Latham on his way
holds its line outside off and beats the outside edge. Good length from Shakib, drawing the batsman forward, but not allowing him to get to the pitch
flighted outside off, drives into the covers
moves back and flicks a shortish delivery on middle through square leg
tossed up onto off stump, defends it off the front foot
moves back and punches a quicker, flatter delivery to long-on. That'll be drinks as well

rapped on the pad. There's a big appeal, but looks like the ball pitched outside leg and would have gone over. This was a short of length delivery which Neesham tried to work through to square leg. Replays indicate an inside-edge too. Good decision from Paul Reiffel
leans forward and drives it straight to mid-off

tries to bounce him, but Neesham takes him on. Manages to top edge the pull but the small boundaries  mean fine leg had no chance but to just watch it sail over. Bangladesh shouldn't mind that, really
stays inside the crease and bunts the away-going short of length delivery to the off side
angles a length ball across, once again the bat is close to the body as he blocks
another appeal for lbw, but Neesham got a big inside edge onto his pad in an attempt to flick. Lots happening for Bangladesh suddenly
quicker one on off from around the stumps, eased back to the bowler
drifting into middle and leg, worked with the angle to long on
touch short on middle, punched wide of midwicket as they jog the single
slider on the stumps from wide of the crease, whipped to deep midwicket
this one's full and flat outside off, there's a hint of turn. Neesham get back and across to defend
plants forward and dabs a full delivery to mid-off
breaks away sharply from off stump, punched back to the bowler
too short, he rocks back and pulls him to deep square leg
flatter delivery that lands on off, Neesham uses the depth of the crease to dab it back down the pitch
too short and he'll pick those away all day, all night. Rocks back, uses the width and flays that into the cover boundary
short again, this time it's been punched down the ground as they amble through
there's some loop and turn this time, eased wide of cover for a quick single
flatter delivery on middle, pushed back down the pitch
makes some room and punches it to wide long-off
flat-batted punch this time to long-on. Too short from Shakib, enough time for the batsman to adjust
this one skids back in as he shuffles across, worked to midwicket
driven with the spin to wide long off
looks to sweep but realises the ball's full and flat for him to do that. Gets across the stumps and blocks instead
enough width for him to rock back and crack that through the infield to sweeper cover
lovely flight there, Neesham gets to the pitch of the ball and deadbats that
pushed back to the bowler who stop sit on his followthrough
sees the batsman give him the charge and floats this wide, Neesham adjusts and bunts it down to long off
drift, dip and turn, he gets forward and defends
just fractionally short, and it's enough for Broom to muscle that pull into the deep midwicket boundary. Lined him up early and boom!
bunts a short ball on middle and leg towards long on
lucky to get away with that. Slider on middle and leg, swept straight to short fine leg
pushed off the back foot to long off
this time he pushes it straight to short midwicket
shapes to sweep but this one's fired in, Neesham blocks it in the end
punched down to long on for an easy single
tucked towards the man coming in from deep square
this one drifts away from off stump, he gets forward and blocks
driven with the spin to Mashrafe at cover
this one's flighted and on the pads, flicked straight to midwicket
gets a thick inside edge to the right of midwicket as he looks to ease it down the ground

mid-off was brought into the ring, and Neesham has picked the gap to perfection. Chips down the track and lofts him over the infield. Mahmudullah tried to pull the ball back in but his body was in contact with the rope when the ball was in his hand
as good as they come! Sees the flight, dances down the track, gets underneath the delivery and lofts him with the spin over extra cover. Elegant
quicker
too full for him to cut, adjusts to punch it down the ground
slider on middle from around the stumps, played back to the bowler
picks the gap at cover, just bunts it into the off side and jogs the single
deadbats a quicker delivery on off stump
driven with the angle to long-on for a comfortable single
eased wide of short midwicket for an easy single
can't find the gap at deep midwicket this time. Too short and pulled straight to the man there
picks the gap between deep square and deep midwicket to perfection. Looked like he wanted to go over long-on, may have got a bit of an inside edge. But the bats these days are really, really sweet

what was the need to do that, I wonder. Steps out to go over long-on but is completely deceived in flight. Mosaddek also did well to fire this a little wide, which meant Neesham had to reach out. He played too early, missed it completely. So far he was down the wicket that Nurul, despite a fumble, managed to whip the bails off quickly.
gets forward and stabs the full ball to the off side
angles a length ball on middle and leg, it skids back in as he defends to midwicket
hops across and nurdles the incoming length ball towards fine leg
beaten for pace, played too early and saw the short of length delivery thud into his thigh pad
uppish flick but on the bounce to fine leg. Pick up shot this time, the man lurking round the corner came around but it just landed short
squared up by one that nips away late. He's opened up completely as the ball rolls off the shoulder of the bat to the off side
too full on middle and leg, he pushes outside the line and gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
fetches the flick from outside off towards long on
excellent stop off his own bowling, throwing himself to his right to stop that firm push
this time he picks the gap, gets to the pitch of the ball and works it to long off
rocks back and cuts to the man at sweeper cover
wonder if he was trying to bowl a carrom ball. Looked like it slipped out of his hand and turns into a short ball on middle and leg, whipped to deep square
neat little paddle. Gave away his intentions nice and early, but the bowler did little to alter his line of attack and bowled it on middle

big, big appeal for caught behind but umpire Chris Brown is certain there was no edge. There was a faint little noise though. It was too close to cut, he went through with the stroke but was late on the stroke
on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket

the skipper has scythed through Munro's defence. This is a deadly delivery. This one's bowled full on middle and off, the seam position is so perfect that it nips back in off the seam to beat Munro's tentative push outside the line. The middle stump is knocked back. Bangladesh are happy or what. Trouble for New Zealand
defended towards mid-on, wanted the single in his quest to get off the mark but there was no chance of a run there
full and swings away from off, excellent leave
uppish drive, on the bounce to mid-off
driven inside-out to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, there's some purchase off the pitch too. Left alone
invites the drive by giving it generous flight outside off, he plays the stroke but straight to cover
tapped gently towards point as they scamper a single
nearly yorked himself, looked to go downtown but had to jam his bat down in the end to keep that out
drifts in and spins away from middle, punched to midwicket
errs in line, too short down leg, tickled to fine leg
this is full on off from wide of the crease, hint of away movement off the deck. Ronchi defends from the crease
close to the stumps at length, covers the line and eases it back down the pitch

played outside the line of that full-length delivery on middle, got the inside edge towards midwicket but was ready to take the fielder on, no damage done even as the throw is fired at the bowler's end
gets a good stride forward and showcases text book forward defence
cut away. The timing is outstanding. Just a hint of width, mind you, but he picked the length early, and played it latr to beat the point fielder. Third man had no chance
super stop by the skipper at cover.  Saved four runs for the side.  Crisp drive and he threw himself full stretch to pull off a one-handed stop
driven with the spin to sweeper cover
played back to the bowler
drifts into middle, he plays it with the spin but can't pierce the gap at cover
can't get underneath the flight, pushed to cover
past the diving cover fielder for an easy single
lucky to get away with a short and wide delivery outside off, thumped straight to point
this time he slides it on leg stump, worked to fine leg as they jog the single
floats this full on middle and leg, worked into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
once again the line not too good, on the pads, he brings his wrists into play to ease that wide of square leg
punched straight to point
beaten by a beauty that squares him up. Played inside the line and was completely opened up by the late movement
flighted outside off, drives through point
a little short in length this time, Ronchi hangs back and cuts through point. There's a man in the deep
tossed up on off stump, pushes to cover

flighted onto middle and off stump, Broom puts in a strong front foot stride and sweeps around it to the fine leg boundary. Powerful shot. Helped that the ball was on a length so he could leverage it away. Any fuller and he could have been in trouble
drives to long-off
flighted on off stump, drills it down the ground
eases it off the open face through to deep point
gets in line with a shortish delivery on off stump
shortish and outside off, evades it
short-armed jab over midwicket. Ronchi wants to take on the short ball, but it was cramping him quite a bit. Uses his hands to adjust and whip it over the infield
fuller ball outside off, drives sweetly through to the sweeper cover.
pushes it through on middle, Broom keeps to his crease and blocks with a straight bat
flatter delivery on off stump, taps into the covers
flighted outside leg, nudges to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, defends
pushes it back to the bowler
flatter delivery on off stump, carves it to short third man. That takes us to drinks
cuts him in half. This is back of a length on off stump, hits the seam and decks back in. Hurtles through the gap between bat and pad as even a set batsman is caught on the crease
fuller delivery outside off, glides it to point

smacked behind point! It wasn't entirely short, but was plenty wide enough for Ronchi to throw his arms at it. His balance is on the front foot, opens the face thereafter and slices it fine enough that the sweeper is only a spectator
short and wide outside off, Ronchi tries to cut and is beaten
back of a length, cramping him up on middle, defends
full and down leg, Ronchi was looking to flick it away, perhaps in the air. behind square leg. Certainly went at it hard enough. Only problem - he misses the ball

pulls out the sweep, makes sure it goes along the ground to deep square leg. Mild appeal from the wicketkeeper about the run-out and the umpire at square leg, Chris Brown, on debut, decides he might as well check it. Replays reveal Broom was several yards in
flatter delivery on off stump, pushes back at the bowler
pushed through full on off stump, defends to cover
lunges forward to a flighted delivery outside off and sweeps it to deep square leg.
short and wide, Ronchi rocks back to cut to the sweeper
looped up into the blockhole on leg stump, nudges it to square leg
creams it through the covers. This is a perfectly good length ball around the off stump, but Ronchi's hands are so good. Simply touches the ball with a straight-bat push and it flies away
now he stands up tall to smash a short delivery to the long-on boundary. Dismissive. There was just enough room for him to free the arms. And boy, he put all his power into it
a little width outside off and he carves it through cover
"catch it," someone screams. Well sure, in the crowd
shortish and outside off, cut behind point
tossed up on off stump, Ronchi smashes it to long-on
strides down the track and lofts it over extra cover. Power and placement all in one shot. But it is set up by a quick race down the track to get to the pitch of a flighted ball outside off
weathers an lbw appeal as he goes for a sweep to a ball tossed up outside off. Impact was on the back leg, but not in line with the stumps
rocks back to cut a flatter delivery outside off to the sweeper
"catch," someone cries. Sure, if it's directed at the crowd. Ronchi takes a flighted delivery on off stump and hammers it over long-on
smeared through the covers. Leans forward over the length ball outside off and hits through the line. Is the pitch becoming quicker?
back of a length and outside off, he flirts at it, with an angled bat and is beaten

that's dismal. Takes a short of a length ball on off stump and flicks it straight to midwicket's hands. He's been timing them brilliantly, but this time, he makes contact a little earlier than he wants to. Could have been a bit more bounce as well.
fuller ball on off stump, pushes into the covers
back of a length and outside off, punches to cover. Good on Bangladesh to bring the field up to the new batsman this late in the innings
digs it in short on middle and leg, gets under it
pats a shortish delivery outside off to point. Thinks about a single, but there's nothing on offer
waits a little longer this time, but even then he finds point as Mashrafe's short ball doesn't give the batsman any room
full on middle and off, whips it to deep square leg
moves around the wicket for a bouncer to the left-hander, Santner avoids it
back of a length and outside off, draws Santner into a front-foot block, but the ball holds its line and beats the outside edge

is there an edge? There was a little noise, but no excitement from the Bangladesh players. Mashrafe gets another good length ball to move away off the deck and Santner pushing away form his body is beaten
looks to get on top of the bounce and crack that  behind point but was late on the shot
cuts straight to point this time
crunching cover drive but there's boundary rider to cut that off
pacy length ball across the stumps, Santner stands tall and bunts it to the off side
that is a rip roaring bouncer, Santner does well to sway out of the way and let the keeper collect it in front of his face
pulled and he's struck that really well. Deep square comes around nearly 20 metres to his right to cut that off with one boot.
angles a short ball into middle from around the stumps, defended towards short midwicket
this is  much fuller, he opens the bat face late to ease that between cover and point
that to me is the shot of the day! Sashays down the pitch and whips the incoming length delivery over deep midwicket. Wow, that sailed into the stands. He dragged it across the line too
stays inside the crease and dabs it to the off side
half-forward in defense, the ball rolls off a thick inside-edge to the off side as they punch a run
whipped that superbly, the power of his bottom hand to the fore. Picked the gap between midwicket and mid-on perfectly
trifle short but is lucky to get away a Santner defends to the leg side
skids across the batsman, who fails to connect the cut
the bowler dives over the ball to concede an easy single to long-on
driven but straight to cover. Got too close to the delivery
nudged to the leg side, the man coming in from deep midwicket was late to get off the blocks. He fired an accurate throw alright, but a second's indecision meant the batsman was just in
slider on middle and leg, punched into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on. No hesitation was the key, and both batsmen merely looked up and made the second on eye contact
back of length delivery on middle and leg, wristed towards deep square

fetches the pull from outside off and connects superbly. Sitting up nicely for him to play the stroke. One bounce into the boundary between deep midwicket and long-on. That was bowled no more than 125 clicks
bunts a length delivery to point, refuses the single straightaway
crunched on the up to sweeper cover

as simple as catches come. Santner completely hustled by the bouncer. This was dug in short and it really fizzed through. That didn't stop Santner from going for a pull, got it too high on the bat and Mashrafe, who settled underneath at midwicket, gleefully accepted the dolly.  First ODI wicket for Subasish.
leans into the drive and crunches one to deep cover
gift of a delivery. Full toss outside off, he steps out and slaps that with a touch of disdain into the deep extra cover boundary. Two boundary riders converged but had no chance
eased with the spin to deep cover
gets underneath the flight and eases it inside-out to deep extra cover
gentle little dab towards cover as they steal a quick single
cracking drive, but straight to deep cover. The throw at the bowler's end is wayward, which allows both batsmen to complete the second easily
gets back and across to work that in-drifter to short midwicket
looks for a savage blow down the ground, but couldn't completely get underneath the delivery, straight back to the bowler
errs in length by a fraction and Broom fetches the pull from outside off, bisects deep square and deep midwicket like it's child's play. Marches into the 90s
that's crunched on the up to deep cover
play and a miss. Too close to cut. This was a touch full too for him to play that
play and a miss. No feet movement whatsoever as he looked to whack that over cover
looks to squeeze it behind point but can't get his bat down on time
drifts one into middle and leg, he steps out and turns it towards the man running in from the deep midwicket fence. Top work to keep it to a single

faintest of nicks and he's gone! Southee looks to carve that over cover point but was late on the stroke. Shakib fired this full. The ball went straight on to get a faint nick as the keeper completed a straightforward catch. The bowling change works.
gets a thick outside edge as he defends, down to short third man
get forward and blocks a quicker delivery on middle
slider on middle and leg, he shuffled a long way across and missed it completely. The keeper was blinded too and so couldn't stop it completely
stays inside the crease and blocks

wow. He's swept Bangladesh's captain into the grass banks at deep square leg. Mashrafe floats this full and across the batsman from around the stumps, Broom shuffles across and swings through, it was a top edge but boy, it just kept sailing.
paddles it this time, he's toying with the bowling. One is all he will get as deep square leg comes haring in
attempted bouncer but it was way over the batsman's head, right call from the umpire
gets a thick edge that would have been gobbled up by first slip on another day. But here, it flies into the third man boundary
hops across the stumps and defends an incoming length delivery on middle
gets a faint little nick as he looks to fetch the hook from outside off. As far as decisions go, Paul Reiffell couldn't have asked for easier ones. No. 11 will have to come out now, with Broom on 99.
through bat and pad. Plays outside the line of that delivery which nips back in from outside off. Keeper dives low to his left to gather that

there's his  first ODI century.  This has been an innings of quality and they rise to applaud a super knock at the Saxton Oval. Coming back to the delivery, it was full, he prodded forward and bunted it to the off side to scamper across. Returns to the squad after six years and delivers. Super knock
digs a short ball in but that was angled in to middle and leg, Boult sways iut of the way
mistimes an attempted flat-batted swap, midwicket runs back and they come back for the second. Broom could have just kept that down to a single if he wanted to, though
looks to back away and flay that over point, but the ball skids on and takes the top half of the bat, eludes cover.
stays inside the crease and defends a short of length delivery to the off side
this is a cracking bouncer! Not much Boult could have done but just sway out of the way
floats this full and wide outside off, he makes room and slogs that towards deep extra cover, got that off the toe end
dropped.  Tough, tough chance for the keeper. Swung hard, got a thick edge and Nurul, who tried to take a one-handed reflex-action catch, managed to save three runs by taking some glove on it
looks to go down town, bottom edges it back down the pitch. The bowler times his jump well to stop that
this has been hammered. Tracer bullet stuff, mid-off had no chance. It was full and in his swinging zone, the bat was down with some ferocity
up, up and away. More frustration for Bangladesh. Short, he looks to play a flat-batted pull and gets enough bat on it to elude mid-off
squeezes out a yorker  back to the bowler
swung across the line, toe ends it to long-on, a single it will be

tennis ball bounce on that one, Boult was late to get off the blocks, the keeper flicked an under-arm throw to Taskin, who simply had to collect the throw and walk to the stumps and remove the bails. He fumbled. Could prove costly
McCullum style ramp! Walks way outside the line of the stumps and scoops that length ball over short fine leg. Super execution
pulls and misses. Played too early and connected with thin air. He also had to fetch it from outside off
shocker of a delivery, a full toss down leg, flicked to deep square leg.

backs away to carve that over the off side, misses but they decide to steal a bye. This time, Taskin collects the keeper's underarm throw cleanly and then runs up a few yards behind to remove the bails at the non-striker's end. Broom walks back unbeaten. Super, super knock

inn2.comm: starts off with a wayward delivery down leg side, easy call for the umpire
this is much better. Fuller and closer to off stump, he gets forward and defends
this time the ball move back in a wee bit from the length area on off stump, Tamim defends from the crease
gets on top of the bounce and defends the short of length delivery back down the pitch
firm push but straight to cover point. Some late away movement for Boult
floats this at length on off from wide of the crease, Tamim goes forward and across, blocks
sliding into middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket for a quick single to get off the mark
starts off bang on target. Length ball on middle stump, not much away movement. Tamim plants forward confidently and defend
flayed behind point. Width on offer and Tamim climbed onto that in a jiffy. Third man had no chance.
gets a good stride forward as he defends the away-going length ball

too short. This time Tamim gets on top of the bounce and pulls him behind square. The beauty of the stroke was in that he hit it all along the ground. Lovely roll of the wrists to ensure that was the case
called one bouncer for the over. Tamim thought of the hook but pulled out because of steep bounce
gift of a delivery. A juicy half-volley on the pads and Tamim tickles it past the diving Luke Ronchi into the fine leg boundary
bangs a short of length delivery that nips away late to square Tamim up, but he adjusts well to defend
gets on top of the bounce and bunts the back of length delivery to the off side
looks for the inswinger this time. Floats one in from wide of the crease, defended to the off side with minimal feet movement
buffet bowling this. Playing into the hands of the batsman. Too full and on the pads, Kayes tickles it fine. No chance for the keeper. All he needed to get was a minute deflection
solidly behind the line of the ball in defense
shows the full face of the bat to defend the incoming length ball
opens the bat face late and jab at an away-going length delivery
there's some inward movement in the air, this is much fuller, Tamim covers the line, gets forward and defends
cut away but can't pierce the gap behind point
cuts and misses. Not much width for him to execute a full-blooded stroke like that
gets the radar wrong. This one at length on middle and leg, he hops across to whip it to deep square
goes back to over the wicket and bowls a leg-stump half-volley that has been flicked to deep square leg
this one nips away off the seam from length area on middle, Kayes is rock solid in defense
gets this to nip back in from wide of the crease, defended back down the pitch
opens the bat face late and steers it down to third man as they jog the single
pulls but can't get hold of it. Straight to midwicket
thick edge down to third man. Looked like he wanted to get it a lot squarer, and behind point
unfurls those wrists late to find the gap behind point, third man is in business as they take another single
gets up tall to bunt a shortish delivery outside off into the covers. Thinks about a single, but Tamim, rightly, sends him back
good bouncer, at 129 kph, rising up towards his left shoulder at off stump. That's the spot where you get top-edges if the batsman decides to hook
good on Imrul to keep coming forward despite that short ball, stands tall and crunches this to point. Would have been four had he picked the gap
back of a length on off stump, pushes to mid-off
attempts a pull to this bouncer - Southee aims for middle this time - and at the very last moment, Imrul realises this is getting too big on him and aborts the shot
steers a back of a length delivery behind point. No maiden then, a lovely over nonetheless
fuller ball on off stump, pushes it back to the bowler firmly
shortish and outside off, Imrul waits on it, and then pulls off a bottom-handed whip through wide mid-on
fullish on middle and leg, defends, gets a thick inside edge through midwicket
fuller ball on off stump, blocks it with an open face that sends the ball behind point
cracked through point. This is the result of opening the face as well, but Imrul chooses to add a lot more punch into the stroke. The length makes him do so, a tad bit short from Boult
tucks him up on middle and leg, Imrul flicks it to midwicket
comes forward to block a fuller delivery on off stump

a rush of blood and this is a familiar dismissal for Tamim. Comes down the track and belts a length ball straight to short cover. Dot-ball pressure does him. Well, it isn't exactly pressure. The target is only 251. It's just him feeling bogged down. It's him making a bad mistake
shortish on middle and leg, clips it to midwicket
fuller delivery on off stump, turns it to midwicket. Sweet timing. Placement, meh. He's still new though. That'll come together eventually
back of a length and outside off, offers no shot
shortish and wide outside off, Sabbir avoids it
back of a length on off stump, blocks it
fuller ball on middle, eased to mid-on
pulls the length back, and takes the line a little wider outside off to see if Imrul will bite. He does. Goes for the on-the-up drive and is beaten
shortish on off stump, but the angle into him helps him work the ball through midwicket
full and outside off, carves it to short cover. Sabbir's timing is delightful so far. Having trouble placing the ball
back of a length and on off stump, guides it to point
stands tall and smashes a back of a length ball to point. Only a hint of width, but Imrul picks it up so early. Had he placed it a yard wide of the fielder, it would have been four
steers to point again. The line is closer to off stump so Imrul can't get any power on it
struts out the bouncer as the batsman seems eager to get on the front foot. Imrul thinks about the pull, but bails out. Good choice. It was rising too high over his left shoulder
drives to mid-off. Southee looks in fine rhythm too. Stringing three, four sets of dots almost every over

that's a top edge. Imrul's patience with the short ball runs out. Sees one around chest-height, on middle stump, and goes for the hook. Boult at long leg thinks he is in business, running in quickly, but the ball drops well short of him
gets an inside edge as he lines up to a shortish ball outside off
this ball is about a foot wide of leg stump and all Imrul has to do is get a little bat on it. Fine leg is up. He has a chase on his hands. He loses it

dropped. A seriously tough chance though, with Munro having to abandon his follow through and to get low to his right, all in a matter of a split second. Its a length ball on off stump, drivable, which is why Imrul goes for the shot but the ball holds in the pitch and doesn't come on.
taps it into the covers
opens the face and glides a length ball to point
opens the face to point
shortish on the pads, clipped to deep square leg

136 kph, short delivery on off stump, the batsman dabs it with soft hands and looks for a quick single. Sabbir seems okay about it and is suddenly in trouble as Ferguson races towards the ball. Picks it up one-handed and throws it towards the stumps - it's a wild one though, going well over the mark. As all that happens. Ferguson baically runs over Sabbir. Not intentionally, he was off balance after the throw and Sabbir was diving to make his ground so became an insta-obstacle
146kph, back of a length and outside off, stands up tall and runs it to deep third man
142kph, beaten for pace as this shortish delivery on leg stump cramps him up. Pings off the thigh pad to point

super shot. Rides the pace and bounce as he cuts behind point. There was a backward point, a cover point and a third man in the deep. Split the first two, and placed it well to the right of the other guy
back of a length on off stump, defends to the left of midwicket
gets in line with a 142 kph short delivery on off stump
full on off stump, turns it to midwicket
oooh, he goes full and offers with with mid-off up. Imrul makes him pay by getting a good stride forward and smacking the ball up and over to the long-off boundary
shortish and outside off, works it to midwicket
shortish on the pads, Imrul picks it away through square leg
nudges it off middle stump to deep midwicket
short and wide, Imrul goes for the cut a tad too early and mistimes the shot through cover
back of a length on off stump at 147 kph, Imrul defends well

outside edge, but it falls short of the first slip. Imrul is forward, poking at a good length ball in tentative fashion. Latham was perhaps a little wider than normal, and has to dive to his right to field the ball. Ronchi steps in and looks for a run-out. Sabbir would have been gone had he hit
banged in severely short and it goes past Sabbir well over his head
overpitched outside off and the lashing blade of Sabbir sends it to the cover boundary. Could be 146 kph, but if it's off target...
makes him hop with a short ball on off stump, Sabbir though is able to get on top of the bounce by hopping and calmly nudges it through square leg
145kph, good length ball, pats it to mid-off and scurries across
aims it full on middle, nudges into the leg side
tossed up on leg stump, drives it to long-on
gets down the track and pushes down the ground, Santner is quick to move to his right and stop a single

Broom dives at short fine leg to stop a full-blooded sweep. Excellent shot from Sabbir, taking a flighted ball from outside off, making sure lbw was out of the picture and rolling his wrists on top of it. Equally fine work from Broom, diving to his right to protect the boundary
good length ball on off stump, defends
quicker ball, just outside off, Sabbir goes back for a late cut but can't beat point
bangs it in short, down leg, avoids it
rises with the short ball at 144 kph, just outside off, and steers it to deep third man
oversteps now as a shortish delivery outside off is met with a belligerent, if mistimed, cut shot. Oh, but replays indicate a bit of his back heel is behind the crease
goes for the back of the hand slower ball, Sabbir holds his stance, winds up and flat bats it over the long-on boundary
back of a length and outside off at 147 kph, defends
stays in line with a 144 kph back of a length delivery that is steered to point
fuller ball outside off, pushes it back down the pitch
short and wide, Sabbir smacks it behind point. There is protection in the deep
tossed up on off stump, drives past the bowler's reach to long-off
goes for a paddle sweep - a premeditated one - which is why when the ball is tossed up on off stump, he gets an inside edge to midwicket
comes down the track, and yorks himself doing so as a flighted delivery on off stump, gets an inside edge and saves him
looped up above the eyeline and outside off, Sabbir goes for a slog, and instead hits the ball off the bottom of the bat and sends it back to Santner
pushes it to midwicket's left
fizzy delivery - short and at good pace on middle, Imrul gets on top of the bounce and nurdles it to the leg side

imperious! Picks the length early, swivels back, rolls his wrists nicely to keep it all along the ground. If you can pull in front of square to a bowler clocking in excess of 140 clicks, it means you're sighting the ball well
tries to bowl a short ball on the rib cage but loses direction. It ends up being way down leg and over the head
flayed away, wanted to go over point but he managed just a thick edge down to third man

that is a cracking delivery. A bouncer in at 142.3 kph on off stump from wide of the crease, Sabbir was caught in an awkward tangle as he looked to sway out of the way. Gloves not too far away from the ball
uses the depth of the crease to hop back and defend that short ball on middle and off
goes for a full-blooded drive, crunched straight to mid-off
slider on off from around the stumps, played back down the pitch
pushed through quicker on middle, shows the full face of the bat in defense
gets outside the line of the stumps and paddles it down to fine leg. He intended to sweep it towards deep square. Would have been really close had he missed that
full and straight on the pads, turned to midwicket
swing and a miss. Not needed at this stage, really. Looks for a big mow over deep midwicket, was deceived in flight and is lucky the ball hit his body and didn't spin past
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it with the spin to long on as they jog the single
starts off with a wayward delivery outside off, some exercise for the umpire
dab and run, eased to the off side as they steal a single
cut and a miss. Width was on offer, sitting up nicely for him to go over point but he played too early
gets across the stumps and defends the length ball to the off side
opens the face of the bat to steer that one towards square third man. The fielder had to run around 20 yards and then throw into the wind. Excellent presence of mind from Sabbir
crashed on the up, but straight to mid-off. I reckon that's the best shot that hasn't produced a run today
whipped off his hip towards long leg
gets inside the line to sweep, hit on the glove
pushed through quicker on middle, the angle was taking it down, he is hit on the pad as he tries to work across the line
catch was the call, but it was a question of who. Steps out and swings across the line to muscle that flighted delivery into the grass banks at deep midwicket.
drops it between cover and point gently as they scoot across for a single
eased with the turn to short fine leg, no chance of a single on that occasion
drifter across the batsman from around the stumps, tucked towards square leg for a quick single
direct hit at the striker's end from the fielder running in from point, but Sabbir was well in. Sensible from Imrul to simply dab and run wherever possible. Not just about the 4s and 6s
bangs a short ball way over the batsman's head, or so it looked. The umpires give each other a glance, legal delivery
walks across to off stump and swipe towards midwicket, toe-ends it to mid-on instead
slower and fuller on off stump, he opens the bat face late to steer it to point

top edge and that has flown way into the stands at fine leg. For a moment it looked like the man there was in busines. Once again, he decided to take him on but at no stage did he intend to keep it down, and so he went with all his might, and got enough wood on that hook shot.
stands tall and punches a length ball off the back foot to sweeper cover
eased with the spin back to the bowler
fires one down leg, Sabbir sweeps and misses. Needed some bat on it to get it past short fine leg. Scoring opportunity missed
gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps to deep square leg
swept uppishly again, but over the infield to deep fine leg
wanted to give him the charge but had to adjust after the bowler dropped it short, cut away to point
this time, he rocks back and cuts wide of the diving cover fielder

absolute hara-kiri, oh dear. Silly, silly running between the wickets. Kayes dabs it to short cover and sets off for a single. His partner initially responds but suddenly stops and turns back to the crease. At one point, both batsmen are in the race for the non-striker's end. So absent-minded was Sabbir that Kayes overtook him. Kayes thought he was out and was just about to exit when the umpires went upstairs to check who was actually out. Sabbir gets a rude shock of his life when he finds out he has to go. Coming back to the fielding effort, the wicketkeeper did really well to collect the throw on the half-volley and then whip the bails off. The only way a wicket looked like falling at this stage was a run-out.
gets on top of the bounce and eases it wide of point
hustled for pace, this one comes back in as he hops back and across to defend
whipped wide of square leg as they scamper through for a quick single
gets half-forward and bunts the length ball to the off side
opens the face of the bat and eases that length delivery to point
super bouncer, fizzed off the deck. Mahmudullah just managed to get his glove out of the way
worked with the spin to long on as they jog the single
gets forward and dabs it to the off side
drifts down leg, Mahmudullah gets a faint little tickle, or did he? Umpire reckons it was off the pad, down to fine leg
backs away and bunts it to the off side
turned with the angle to square leg for an easy single

Has Ferguson dropped the match?  This was an ugly slog sweep, the top edge was going straight down his throat where he juggled thrice and put down an absolute dolly. Very, very poor. At this level, or any level for that matter, you have to take those. He went reverse cup when he could have actually taken it the traditional way
gets back and bunts it to the off side
opens the face of the bat and steers it down to third man

he put down a dolly in the last over, and has now sent back Mahmudullah with an absolute scorcher of a delivery at 144 clicks. This is full, and furiously fast on off stump from wide of the crease. Mahmudullah was probably expecting a short ball and was rooted to the crease. The ball dipped really fast and the ball had hit the base of off stump when the bat came down.
sways out of the way of the short ball on middle
gets on top of the bounce and turns it to the leg side
uses the pace of the bowler to glide that short ball over point. Square third man comes around to cut that off
driven with the spin to sweeper cover as they jog the single
makes some room and punches the short ball to cover
eased with the spin wide of cover for an easy single
sloppy effort from the skipper off his own bowling, the deflection rolls to mid-off as the batsmen steal a single
pushed through quicker on middle, defended to cover
width on offer, crunched to deep point
angles a short ball across the batsman, who looks to ramp it over the vacant cordon but can't get any bat on it because of the pace
slants a short ball in towards the rib cage, he gets on top of the bounce and awkwardly keeps it out

cuts and gets enough wood on it to race away into the third man boundary. That's his half-century, muted celebration. He knows the job isn't done yet. Having been involved in a terrible mix-up, the onus is on him to take them as close to the target as possible
uses the pace and angle to run it down to third man
slower delivery, Shakib was deep inside the crease in anticipation of a short ball, eases it back down the ground in the end
cracked away over point. Too short and it had all the pace in the world for Shakib to crash that over the infield. Full marks for the execution
driven with the spin to mid-off as they jog the single
nearly yorked himself. This was fired full and flat on middle from around the stumps
cuts but straight to point
too far outside off for the batsman to attempt a stroke, exercise for the umpire
absolute half-tracker that, and Shakib, who had all the time in the world to rock back and cut behind point, slices it to short third man. The game is turning, and turning very quickly
gets forward and deadbats the quicker delivery on middle
squared up by the short ball that jags away a wee bit, he's get back and defends
opens the bat face late to steer it down to third man for an easy single
looks to arch back and run it down, there's not much room as the ball deflects off the glove towards third man
wristy little whip from outside off towards mid-on
play and a miss. Loose stroke brought about because of all those wickets. No feet movement, simply threw his hands at the away-going delivery
beaten! Nervous little poke. This one swerved away a lot more than he expected. Once again, his front foot was on middle, but the bat was well outside off as he had a flirt at that
tossed up on leg, tried to make room but was cramped, squeezed it down to long on somehow
gets underneath the flight and eases it down to long on for an easy single
cuts, but a super stop at point keeps it down to a single

credit for this wicket should go to the point fielder, who saved a second run off the previous delivery. This one is nicely tossed up outside off, Mosaddek looks to clear mid-off but ends up hitting it flat and straight to the fielder. Didn't get underneath the flight whatsoever. Poor application, Bangladesh are falling apart here.
tossed up on off stump, drives to long-on
leans forward to push a flighted delivery to long-off
digs it in and it climbs higher and higher outside off, Kayes goes for the upper cut, but fails to make a connection
sways away from a bouncer at 130 kph. Passes right over middle and off stump

he's skewed the ball to gully. Bangladesh coming apart at the seams and it looks ugly. This is a wide, length ball, and Kayes, despite being a set batsman, doesn't move his feet the required amount and ends up playing away from the body. Ends up slicing the ball to Broom
weathers a bouncer, coming up over his left shoulder. Helps it away to long leg
evades a bouncer outside off
appeal for a caught behind down the leg side as Southee delivers a very full delivery on the pads. Tabir tries a flick and misses. Umpire Brown, unswayed by the appeal, signals wide.
lands another yorker, beats the batsman for pace and blows a kiss to the off stump on its way through. Such a tease.
stays back to a length ball outside off and dabs it behind point
pushes it into the covers to get a single
tossed up outside off, Nurul leans forward and clips it to the left of midwicket.

superb stuff from Ronchi. This is almost a yorker, sneaks under Tanbir's bat as he was shimmying down the pitch, the dip surprising him. The wicketkeeper has very little time to react because the ball was pitched so full. He has to stay low, takes the ball cleanly and whips the bails off. Third wicket for the New Zealand captain in his fourth over
blocks a flatter delivery on off stump
quicker delivery outside off, pushes into the covers
full toss, into the body, and Nurul whips it away towards the long leg boundary. The man there has to rush to his left
fuller delivery on off stump, defends
sticks in a bouncer on middle, the batsman avoids it
back of a length on off stump, blocks to mid-on
short and outside off, he drops his wrists and sways out of the way
full, and seems to tail in late, Mashrafe is able to block it out
shimmies down to a good length ball outside off, defends
launches a length ball outside off to the long-off boundary. Mashrafe is a big-hitter, and this needs a loooot of big hitting
slogs it away to deep midwicket. Williamson does well to hold the ball back and make him mis-hit
steers a flatter delivery outside off behind point
pushed through outside off, pushes it to cover. The non-strikers seems to want a single, which prompts a direct hit. And the ricochet allows them the run in the end
goes back to flick the length ball to midwicket
backs away, and even though Southee follows him, he doesn't get the bouncer up high. Mashrafe swivels on his back foot and pulls it over midwicket
moves around the wicket for a short ball, which wanders aimlessly past leg stump
digs it in, angling it at Mashrafe's head from around the wicket. The batsman ducks under it
continues the bouncer barrage - although this is only at 118 kph - Mashrafe was thinking about a pull, before bailing out of it
he's fallen over while playing a hook. It's a quick, short ball, approximately on leg stump. Mashrafe swings, but the ball skips past his left ear and leaves him behind
another short ball, down leg, Mashrafe evades it
likes the look of this short ball because it gives him the room to free the arms. Hangs back, sets himself up with a strong base and pulverises the ball over the square leg boundary
fuller delivery on off stump, Nurul taps it to the left of short midwicket
squares him up with a back of a length delivery that seems to straighten down the line. Nurul manages to slot it in the gap at cover
back over the wicket to Mashrafe, who looks at a length ball moving across him and takes it on. Slog and a miss

taken at mid-off as Boult deceives Mashrafe with a slower ball. He was on the back foot, swinging straight through the line. This same length - full on off stump - would have disappeared had it come at full pace. But this is the offcutter. Arrives a lot later than the Bangladesh captain expects and he skews it off the bottom of the bat
back of a length and outside off, tentative little poke becomes an inside edge to short fine leg
change of pace again as he sneaks in a back of a length delivery outside off, Nurul tries a cut and misses. Ronchi fumbles behind the stumps. Hasn't made many mistakes behind the stumps today.
starts with a short ball that pushes Nurul back in his crease. Defends to cover
moves back and across and helps it away to the long leg boundary. Lovely shot. Used all the 130 kph that is there on the ball as he half scoops the ball to the left of Neesham
covers the line of this 134 kph short ball on off stump

that's the proper scoop, over the third man boundary. Takes a lot of guts to play this shot to a bowler who is capable of hitting 150. This is Ferguson's third spell though, and he tends to motor down late in the day. Offers it up in the slot for Nurul to get under and hoist it over his right shoulder
slides it over to the man on the boundary at third man
back of a length and outside off, Taskin pokes and misses.
digs it in short and down leg, the batsman goes for a pull but can't quite connect
back of a length on off stump, nudges it into the leg side
opens the face against a back of a length delivery on off stump. Cover swoops in before they could think about singles
full on off stump, digs it out
full on off stump, nudges it to the left of midwicket, who is quick enough to deny the single
waits on the back foot and steers it behind point
lands a yorker on leg stump, works it to midwicket
tossed up outside off, pushes to mid-off
targets middle, Taskin clips it to short midwicket

good work from Ronchi again, as he covers the slider - pushed through past the advancing left-hander's outside edge - and flicks the bails off in a flash. Deft work, from both Santner and the wicketkeeper
Tossed up on off stump, pushes it back to the bowler
Looped up onto leg stump, keeps it out
Good length ball outside off, taps into the covers
full on leg stump, jabs it down to mid-on

opens the face to glide the back of a length delivery to third man. Nurul wonders about a single, taking a few steps down, Subashis goes through for the single alright, but his partner was very reluctant. In the end the matter was taken out of his hands
stands rooted to the crease and guides a fuller delivery past point's right
full and wide, Nurul lashes it through to the sweeper
lands a yorker which beats the batsman. It beats the off stump as well, with him bowling over the wicket
tossed up on off, driven back to the bowler
slow turn from middle, whipped to deep midwicket
stylish push to cover
opens the bat face and steers a short ball to short third man
gets the bat well in front of the pad and blocks
too close to cut, he rocks back and dabs it to the off side
nearly chopped on. Gets a thick inside edge that flies past leg stump. Fine leg had to come around a bit to cut that off. Southee saves a couple of runs
slower and fuller outside off, looks like the ball slipped out of hi hand
half-volley on the pads, flicked into the vacant spaces at deep backward square leg
floats this full on off, pushed to cover

pacy bouncer on middle and leg, he goes for a hook but the ball got big on him. He got himself into a tangle and the ball brushed the glove on the way through to Ronchi. There was nothing on HotSpot, but real time snicko produces a small spike. After some deliberation, umpire C Shamsuddin has given it out.  That's the series to New Zealand.
